Covid_tests: All travelers must have proof of a negative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test result issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure, or an antigen test result issued no more than 24 hours prior to departure.
Forms: All travelers must submit a Traveler's Health Declaration (DSV) form no more than 24 hours prior to departure.
Masks: Not required
Quarantine: Unvaccinated travelers must undergo a 14-day quarantine. Travelers can end quarantine early by undergoing testing for COVID-19.
Vaccination: Travelers must carry proof they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a COVID-19 vaccine approved for emergency use by the World Health Organization (WHO), or must undergo quarantine.

Masks: Masks are strongly recommended in any crowded setting.
Quarantine: All travelers may be randomly selected to undergo testing-on-arrival. Unvaccinated travelers must undergo a 14-day quarantine.
Vaccination: Travelers fully vaccinated with an approved vaccine for COVID-19 are exempt from the ban on non-essential travel and from pre-departure testing and quarantine requirements.

Covid_tests: All travelers permitted to enter must carry proof of a negative result for COVID-19 issued no more than 48 hours prior to departure using a PCR-based nucleic acid test.
Forms: All travelers must submit a Health & Quarantine Information Declaration form prior to departure.
Masks: Masks are required during travel and in most public venues.
Vaccination: All travelers must carry a recognised vaccination record showing they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a COVID-19 vaccine  recognized by local authorities.

Covid_tests: Travelers lacking proof of vaccination must have proof of a negative RT-PCR test result for COVID-19 issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure.
Forms: All travelers must use the online Air Suvidha Portal to submit a Self-Declaration Form (SDF) and their COVID-19 test results or vaccination certificate.
Masks: Required in most public locations.
Quarantine: Travelers will be randomly selected to undergo testing-on-arrival for COVID-19. Persons who test positive must self-isolate.
Vaccination: Travelers carrying accepted proof they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a WHO-approved COVID-19 vaccine are exempt from pre-departure testing requirements.

Covid_tests: Unvaccinated travelers must have proof of a negative reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test result for COVID-19 issued no more than 48 hours prior to departure.
Forms: Visa-free entry and visa-on-arrival services are available. All travelers must install and use the PeduliLindungi mobile application for contact tracing purposes.
Masks: Masks are required in most public spaces.
Quarantine: All travelers must undergo temperature screening upon arrival. Persons determined to have a high temperature must undergo an RT-PCR test and must self-isolate while awaiting their results. Unvaccinated travelers must undergo a 5-day quarantine.
Insurance: Foreign nationals traveling for tourism must have proof of medical insurance valid for use in Indonesia for the entire duration of their intended stay with a minimum coverage amount of at least US$25,000.
Vaccination: Travelers who carry proof they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a COVID-19 vaccine recognized by Indonesian authorities are exempt from pre-departure testing and quarantine requirements.

Covid_tests: All travelers permitted to enter Japan must carry proof of a negative nucleic acid amplification test (NAAT) result issued no more than 72 hours prior to departure.
Forms: All travelers (including business travelers) must obtain a valid visa prior to departure. All travelers (including Japanese nationals) must sign and submit a Written Pledge when entering Japan. Travelers must also submit an online Questionnaire and must install the MySOS mobile application.
Masks: Masks are required in most public spaces.
Quarantine: Unvaccinated travelers must undergo a 3-day or a 7-day quarantine either at home or at a designated location. Quarantine duration and location depends on the traveler's pre-departure COVID-19 test result.
Vaccination: Travelers who carry proof they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a COVID-19 vaccine recognized by Japanese authorities are exempt from quarantine requirements provided they also carry a negative pre-departure COVID-19 test result.

Masks: Masks are required on public transportation and in most public venues.

Covid_tests: Unvaccinated travelers authorized to enter Singapore must carry proof of a negative result for COVID-19 issued no more than 2 days prior to departure using a PCR test, a professionally-administered Antigen Rapid Test (ART), or a self-administered ART that is remotely supervised by an ART provider in Singapore.
Forms: All travelers authorized to enter Singapore must submit a  with an electronic health declaration no more than 3 days prior to departure.
Masks: Masks are not required except in certain public venues such as healthcare facilities.
Insurance: Unvaccinated and partially vaccinated short-term visitors authorized to enter Singapore must have proof of medical insurance valid for use in Singapore for the entire duration of their stay with a minimum coverage amount of at least S$30,000.
Vaccination: Travelers who carry proof they have completed a full vaccination regimen using a COVID-19 vaccine approved for use by the World Health Organization (WHO) are exempt from the ban on entry and from pre-departure testing, quarantine, and insurance requirements.
